benchmark_details.name: LiveRepoReflection
benchmark_details.overview: LiveRepoReflection is a challenging benchmark for evaluating code understanding and generation in repository-style multi-file contexts, featuring 1,888 rigorously filtered test cases across 6 programming languages.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the capabilities of large language models in repository-based code understanding and generation tasks.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Evaluation in repository-level multilingual scenarios are not fully explored.

data.source: Diverse programming source code from repositories such as GitHub, Hugging Face, and Exercism.
data.annotation: Manual annotation by graduate students with assistance from large language models.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the proportion of tasks completed correctly and adherence to specified formatting.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better performance and adherence to task requirements.
methodology.baseline_results: Various language models including GPT-4, Claude, and Qwen were evaluated on the benchmark.
methodology.validation: Evaluation conducted on over 40 LLMs with a dynamic leaderboard to track performances.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Data anonymization strategies were not explicitly discussed.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.compliance_with_regulations: The research adheres to ethical guidelines for AI development.
